adjective.description: Of, relating to, or belonging to the aerarians. "aerarian tribune": a member of a class ranking below the equites.

origin: Early 19th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin aerārius (adjective) of or connected with coinage, money, or the treasury, (noun) citizen of the lowest class, who paid only a poll tax + -an; originally after German Aerarier, plural.
